2.question: Which of the following is true about const?

answers.answer: The value of a const cannot change through re-assignment.
A const can be redeclared.
It can only hold integer values.
The value of a const is immutable.

3.question: Which of the following is true about let?

answers.answer: It declares a block scope local variable.
It declares a function.
It declares a global scope variable.
Variables declared with let are hoisted.

4.question: Which of the following is true about null in JavaScript?

answers.answer: null is a primitive type in JavaScript.
null indicates that a variable has been declared but has not yet been assigned a value
null cannot be assigned to a variable.
An uninitialized variable is automatically assigned a value of null.

8.question: Which of the following statements about JavaScript functions is false?

answers.answer: JavaScript functions are not hoisted.
A function can accept other functions as arguments.
JavaScript functions can be anonymous.
A JavaScript function can be a property value in an object.
Defines different style rules for different devices.
Represents a generic container for video and audio content.
Represents a generic container for embedded interactive content.
Renders vector graphics in a designated area of the viewport.
Is preceded by a # character and identifies a unique element.
Is preceded by a . character and identifies multiple elements.
Is preceded by a # character and identifies multiple elements.
Is preceded by a . character and identifies a unique element.

13.question: In the Document Object Model (DOM), window refers to...

answers.answer: The global object in a browser.
An element returned by the DOM API.
An area of a webpage visible to the user.
The generic container of display properties.

14.question: In the Document Object Model (DOM), document refers to...

answers.answer: The main object of the rendered DOM.
The global object in a browser.
The area of a webpage visible to the user.
An array of nodes or elements.
